result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No contact with the victim.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Pay $1,000 Restitution to:  Victim whose initials are AT.
Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges.
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation

miscConds.notes:
Any and all fines, costs, surcharges, and restitution (if any ordered) to be paid directly by the Defendant to the Richland County Clerk of Court. Defendant has 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court. Failure to pay in full within 60 days or failure to stay current on an approved payment plan will result in entry of civil judgment with interest and submission of the debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue State Debt Collection (SDC) Unit.

Defendant to keep the Clerk of Court informed of any change in contact information (address and/or phone number).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph E Broadhead

records.addlTxt:
No direct or indirect contact with AT.

AMENDED 06/17/22: Under order of the court per 940.47(4); defendant shall have no communication with the victim except by an attorney

9:39 AM Defendant Joseph E Broadhead in court, in custody.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adrian W Longacre in court for Joseph E Broadhead. 

Attorney Longacre provides the plea questionnaire form and informs the court that they are enters a plea on all three counts. The joint recommendation is: Count 1 - 2 yr DPA, Count 2 - 90 days jail and Count 3- 1 year probation, no contact with victims and restitution. Court colloquy. Court finds a factual basis. Defendant enters a NC plea on all three counts. Closing comments. 

Court accepts JB plea; finds him guilty and will withhold judgment for DPA of 2 years.

Count 2: 90 days in the Richland County Jail; with huber
Credit of 68 days.
Court costs waived.

Count 3:
Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 1 year.

Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Pay $1,000 Restitution to:  Victim whose initials are AT.
Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges.
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation 


Cash bond converted to signature bond  with the no contact. Court orders  $10,000 signature bond with no contact with the victim whose initials are AT.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:00 AM Defendant Joseph E Broadhead in court, in custody.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Longacre appears in person with the defendant. Attorney Longacre waives the formal reading. Attorney Longacre waives the preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Attorney Forehand  has filed the information that  bring forth the same charges. Attorney Longacre enters a NG plea on all counts.

Attorney Longacre addresses the cash bond that is in place. Court speaks to Attorney Longacre. Attorney Forehand objects any change to the bond. Court asks the ADA about priors of the defendant. Court denies the motion to reduce the case bond. Court speaks about jury trial dates.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection on August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No direct or Indirect contact with AT.

AMENDED 06/17/22: Under order of the court per 940.47(4); defendant shall have no communication with the victim except by an attorney

1:32 PM Defendant Joseph E Broadhead appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Harper appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant doesn't have an attorney and the public defenders office is working on getting an attorney for him.

Court speaks about bail. Attorney Harper speaks about cash bond that is in place and open cases. Attorney Harper asks that there be no modification of bond except to add not to be in Richland County. Court will not modify the bail bond at this time. 

Attorney Harper speaks about the defendant contacting the victim from jail. Court orders: Under order of the court per 940.47(4); defendant shall have no communication with the victim except by an attorney
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:16 PM Defendant Joseph Broadhead appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Wynes appears by video for this hearing only. Attorney Forehand appears for the court. Court finds probable cause.
Attorney Forehand asks for a $5,000 cash bond.
Attorney Wynes request a signature bond. 
Court orders $5,000 cash bond. No contact directly or indirectly with AT.
Initial set for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
